Ask HN: Are browser bookmarks dead? What alternative(s) do you use?
text: For some reason, browsers have yet not implemented a way to __search__ through bookmarks. They also have no user-friendly means of __managing__ bookmarks. I often find myself creating nested folders of bookmarks and I wish there was a way to treat bookmarks as __files__ in a folder. I find the complexity of bookmarks systems prohibitive, and am wondering if there's a better way to keep favorite/important webpages for later use.

Ask HN: Where to find product designer co-founder?
text:
My brother and I have a project we're working on in our spare time. We are both very technical and he has a flair for UX.

https://www.gamedrop.gg/game/hogwarts-legacy

https://www.gamedrop.gg/user/slymilano

We think it's a good idea to look for a third to keep our momentum going and get some focused work in the product design and UX.

Where do you guys recommend we find someone like that? Appreciate any tips, thank you

Ask HN: How do you start contributing to big OS projects?
text:
I'm a junior software engineer, I've been programming for at least 10 years, wayyy before college. I am working on a lot of interesting side projects but I've never really jumped into a big open source project.

I recently wanted to apply for a position in the Firecracker [0] team because the project really interest me and gets me excited, so I thought that contributing to it would increase my chances of getting an interview for that position.

The problem I'm facing right now is that the project feels very intimidating, it's giant and I don't know where to start/how to lay down a strategy to slowly get myself comfortable with it.

Maybe I started with a project that is too complex and definitely requires much more knowledge that I currently have, but I would really love to know other stories and approaches that the HN community have to share on open source contributions other than the classic "start with the good first issue".

[0]: https://github.com/firecracker-microvm/firecracker
